data.title: Finally fixing this
data.body:
Long overdue fix for: 

(in short calculating inertia on mass=0 objects can cause NAN depending on compiler parameters, these NAN will contaminate every other float they come in contact with, resulting in suddenly vanishing objects on jme side, as the nan position/rotation cannot be rendered and is outside frustum.

https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/jmonkey-3-1-native-bullet-bug/33595/3
http://www.bulletphysics.org/Bullet/phpBB3/viewtopic.php?p=12158&f=9&t=

Signed-off-by: Kai Boernert kai-boernert@visiongamestudios.de

data.title: Bugfix: Native Point2PointJoint.createJoint() incorrectly allocates btHingeConstraint
data.body:
The rest of the native methods cast jointId to btPoint2PointConstraint so I've changed createJoint() to allocate a btPoint2PointConstraint.

Forum link: https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/bugfix-for-point2pointjoints-native-createjoint/36147

data.title: Renderer.copyFrameBufferWithFormat only allow to read from the first RenderBuffer of the FrameBuffer.
data.body:
Which is obviously an issue when you use MRT and want to copy one of the multiple target to the CPU.

This line : 
https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/blob/master/jme3-core/src/main/java/com/jme3/renderer/opengl/GLRenderer.java#L1761
is somehow the issue as it gets the first renderBuffer from the frame buffer whatever happens.

there are 2 options to solve this issue IMO : 
1. Allow to pass the required index in the copyFrameBufferBla method, and use frameBuffer.getColorBuffer(index).
2. make getColorBuffer return the renderBuffer in the colorBufIndex index od the buffer list (this variable is set by using FrameBuffer.setTargetIndex, and would make it actually useful).

I'd rather go for option 2.

data.title: FrameBuffer class can't have multiple render targets without bound textures.
data.body:
The FrameBuffer class has a setColorBuffer(Image.Format) method that creates a RenderBuffer without a texture bound.

That's useful when you want to get the rendered buffer copied to the CPU in a byteBuffer unsing the renderer.readFrameBuffer() method.

However, FrameBuffer lack the capability to add multiple render target without a texture bound to the renderBuffer. (only addColorTexture(TextureXXX) is available). 

We should add a addColorBuffer(Image.Format) method.

ps : I'm aware of the setTargetIndex() method, but it actually doesn't solve the issue as it doesn't change the renderBuffer slot, but the index of the renderBuffer in the renderBuffer list (which btw makes me doubt about its usefulness....)

data.title: Fixes #499: Fix Hardware Skinning in 3.1
data.body: ... by implementing proper Array Serialization for MatParams and making the Shared Materials Check only a warning (it would pop up once each time you load the j3o and if you really use Shared Materials you have weird animations and some log spamming)

data.title: added a pre-order traversal of the scene graph
data.body:
This is a clean rework of an older pull request #170 .
This time with an enum to specify pre-order or post-order and without merge conflicts.

data.title: Serialization of Hardware-Skinned j3o's broken
data.body:
Hey Guys,
So the issue is essentially this: With the switch to HW Skinning the Serialization of animated Models changed in two ways:
a) We try to serialize "NumOfBones" and "BoneMatrices" as MatParams. This is wrong since they are regenrated every frame and trigger our "does not support shared materials" warning (since the matrices simply aren't equal)

b) We couldn't serialize Arrays of Matrixf and others so the BoneMatrices were actually null

To fix this issue I proposed the "MatParams" Fix along with the Transiency Attribute for Materials. The Problem here is that since this Information is stored in Material it's decoupled from SkeletonControl.
See [here](https://github.com/MeFisto94/jmonkeyengine/tree/MatParams). It still misses the j3md part, some testing and a more clever array serialization, though.

"Also I noticed that you’re assuming that all matparam arrays are savable arrays in the code, you should probably make sure that they are specifically a Savable[]"

The reason I didn't create a PR is because instead of hacking this in an deleting it in 3.2 again, it might be better to simply backport the 3.2 MPO SkeletonControl to 3.1 and make use of it.

No matter what, we have to do something since it's currently preventing any sdk from loading/saving any animated model

data.title: Add/remove all PhysicsControls even when a RigidBodyControl is present
data.body:
The current implementation of addAll / removeAll doesn't remove rest of the PhysicsControls if the spatial has a RigidBodyControl.

This pull request removes the else-branch so that add / remove is always called for the spatial. Add / remove is no longer present in the `if (spatial.getControl(RigidBodyControl.class) != null)` -branch to prevent the RigidBodyControl from being added / removed twice, thus it only handles joints.

data.title: Ordering + raw methods instead of reversing.
data.body: Continuing the discussion in the pull request: https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/pull/471, made the requested changes.

data.title: AudioListenerState causes positional audio to fail
data.body:
I updated my game to jME 3.1 beta 1, and noticed that all my positional sound effects stopped working.
(By 'stopped working' I mean that the sounds are barely recognizable, and often I don't hear them at all)

Then I noticed that when I stop updating the listener location like this (update in a Control):

```
listener.setLocation(localCharacter.getWorldTranslation());
```

then sounds started to work again. Further research led me to call this at simpleInitApp:

```
stateManager.getState(AudioListenerState.class).setEnabled(false);
```

Now all the positional AudioNodes work correctly again, and I can continue with updating the location of the listener.

Should I do something differently, or is there a defect in AudioListenerState?

data.title: OpenCL for jME3
data.body:
This is a wrapper of OpenCL to jME3.
It provides a portable way to use OpenCL over multiple platforms. The most important fact is the interoperability between OpenGL and OpenCL: you can easily share, access and modify jME3 images, textures, vertex buffers, render buffers from OpenCL kernels.

Link to the forum thread:
[https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/opencl-for-jme3/35750/11](https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/opencl-for-jme3/35750/11)

data.title: FPP or ComposeFilter changes causing issues in 3.1.0-beta1
data.body:
Hi,

I tried using ComposeFilter to combine several previews into one mainviewport via ComposeFilter, but this seems to be breaking in 3.1.0-beta.

My test was:
1. 1 preview with red background rendering into texture
2. 1 mainview, BlackNoAlpha background with ComposeFilter, texture from preview
3. Red screen is expected. 

This works in 3.0.10, but not in 3.1.0-beta

Related discussion:
https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/bug-difference-between-fpp-or-composefilter-between-3-0-and-3-1/35855

data.title: Fix GImpact passing through other shapes.
data.body:
btGImpactCollisionAlgorithm hasn't been registered for physics spaces, causing Gimpact collisions to not be detected.
This pr solves it.

data.title: Using jogl and Offscreen leads to "No OpenGL context current on this thread" error
data.body:
When starting my App with `Type.OffscreenSurface` and a `JOGL_` renderer, I get a `No OpenGL context current on this thread` error.

The problem seems to be that `JoglOffscreenBuffer` calls `GLContext.getCurrentGL()` in a new Thread and there is no `GLContext` attached to that thread.

This applies to 3.1.0-beta1.

data.title: Memory leak in native bullet
Reworked original FBX importer
data.body:
Forum thread: https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/fbx-importer/30309/39?u=eirenliel

Changes from original version:
- Load animations without any additional data (no SceneKeys or fba files) — animations are loaded from separate animation layers (currently not supported by Maya)
- Huge code refactoring. It is possible to work with now and add new features (looks like @shadowislord 's :))
- Added support for not baked transformations (like pre/post-rotations/translation/scale and pivots), all euler rotation orders are implemented too
- More accurate bone animation
- Up to 8 UV-layers
- ByPolygon material data is loaded correctly (without buffer overhead too)
- Textures are loaded by name from the same folder, if present and no better way found
- Added support of FaceCullMode.Off
- Support of axis signs
- Fixes, tons of them!

data.title: Joystick detection on linux and more... (v3.1)
data.body:
This pull request attempt to fix issue on linux where joystick/gamepad are detected whit the wrong logicalId (button name on linux instead of button number on windows).
- add missing .trim() in JoystickCompatibilityMappings.java
- fix some minor logging issue in JInputJoyInput
- add mapping for two gamepad : "GASIA CORP. PLAYSTATION(R)3 Controller", "DragonRise Inc.   Generic   USB  Joystick"
- add a easier way to create a custom joystick mapping in TestJoystick : "push a joystick button and click on the expected mapped button to print the entry for remapping the button"

for more info see the topic on the forum [here](https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/joysticks-detected-with-wrong-logicalid-on-linux/35712)

data.title: Pb ris coming
Filters Don't Display in SDK FilterExplorer
data.body:
Filters added to a .j3f file don't show up in the FilterExplorer. When I load the filters in the game, however, they appear present. This happens in multiple L&Fs. It is still possible, however, to add filters by the usual method of right-clicking on the "filter" node and selecting the filter's name.

![screenshot from 2016-04-23 09-54-48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3982497/14762170/9e2c20f4-0939-11e6-976a-36e8ff407c03.png)

data.title: Bullet native needs recompilation.
data.body:
Linux x64 build of libbulletjme.so is not up to date with the source and need to be recompiled, I don't know if it's the same with other releases.
Some issues caused by this outdated version are:
1. GImpactCollisionShapes do not work
2. getAngularFactor  returns always 0 
3. angular factor set to 0 by default.
